user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_send_init_static_vars_:
```c
void
MHD_send_init_static_vars_ (void)
{
#ifdef HAVE_FREEBSD_SENDFILE
  /* FreeBSD 11 and later allow to specify read-ahead size
   * and handles SF_NODISKIO differently.
   * SF_FLAGS defined only on FreeBSD 11 and later. */
#ifdef SF_FLAGS
  freebsd_sendfile_init_ ();
#endif /* SF_FLAGS */
#endif /* HAVE_FREEBSD_SENDFILE */
#if defined(HAVE_SYSCONF) && defined(_SC_IOV_MAX)
  iov_max_init_ ();
#endif /* HAVE_SYSCONF && _SC_IOV_MAX */
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function MHD_send_init_static_vars_:
static void
iov_max_init_ (void)
{
  long res = sysconf (_SC_IOV_MAX);
  if (res >= 0)
    mhd_iov_max_ = (unsigned long) res;
  else
  {
#if defined(IOV_MAX)
    mhd_iov_max_ = IOV_MAX;
#else  /* ! IOV_MAX */
    mhd_iov_max_ = 8; /* Should be the safe limit */
#endif /* ! IOV_MAX */
  }
}
...
#define HAVE_SYSCONF 1
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I found no pointer declarations, pointer parameters, or expressions involving pointer conversions in the provided code fragments. Both functions (MHD_send_init_static_vars_ and iov_max_init_) have no pointer parameters and perform only integer/sysconf and macro-based operations; mhd_iov_max_ is an unsigned long (not a pointer). Preprocessor conditionals and referenced functions (freebsd_sendfile_init_, iov_max_init_) are called by name only and no pointer types are visible in the shown code. Therefore MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 (pointer should point to const-qualified type whenever possible) is not applicable to any fragment present here. If there are other source fragments that contain pointer declarations or pointer-typed globals/parameters (not shown), those should be provided for review.
